titleStmt.title: An historicall collection of the continuall factions, tumults, and massacres of the Romans and Italians during the space of one hundred and twentie yeares next before the peaceable empire of Augustus Cæsar Selected and deriued out of the best writers and reporters of these accidents, and reduced into the forme of one entire historie, handled in three bookes. Beginning where the historie of T. Liuius doth end, and ending where Cornelius Tacitus doth begin.
titleStmt.author: Fulbecke, William, 1560-1603?.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed [by R. Field] for VVilliam Ponsonby,

notesStmt.note: Dedication and preface signed: William Fulbecke.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
